level3.question: Which cell organelle is responsible for energy production in eukaryotic cells?
What pigment is found in chloroplasts that captures light energy for photosynthesis?
Define osmosis.
options: Movement of water molecules from a region of low solute concentration to high solute concentration through a semi-permeable membrane
Movement of solutes against a concentration gradient
Exchange of gases in the lungs
level3.answer: Movement of water molecules from a region of low solute concentration to high solute concentration through a semi-permeable membrane

level3.question: Which type of blood cell helps fight infections in the human body?
What is the function of red blood cells?
Name the protein responsible for carrying oxygen in red blood cells.
Which part of the plant is primarily responsible for absorbing water and minerals?
What is transpiration?
options: Loss of carbon dioxide from leaves
Loss of water vapor through stomata in leaves
level3.answer: Loss of water vapor through stomata in leaves

level3.question: State one difference between xylem and phloem.
options: Xylem transports water, phloem transports food
Xylem transports food, phloem transports water
level3.answer: Xylem transports water, phloem transports food

level3.question: Which part of the human brain controls balance and coordination?
Define mitosis.
options: Cell division that produces four daughter cells
Cell division that produces two identical daughter cells
Fusion of male and female gametes
level3.answer: Cell division that produces two identical daughter cells

level3.question: What is the main function of the ribosome in a cell?
Give two examples of vertebrates.
What is the role of enzymes in digestion?
options: To speed up breakdown of food molecules
level3.answer: To speed up breakdown of food molecules

level3.question: Which human organ is responsible for filtering waste from the blood?
Name the male reproductive organ in flowering plants.
What is the function of stomata in plant leaves?
options: Exchange gases and allow water loss
level3.answer: Exchange gases and allow water loss

level3.question: Which gas do humans exhale as a waste product of respiration?
State one structural difference between animal cells and plant cells.
options: Plant cells have chloroplasts and cell walls, animal cells do not
Animal cells have chloroplasts and cell walls, plant cells do not
Animal cells have vacuoles, plant cells do not
level3.answer: Plant cells have chloroplasts and cell walls, animal cells do not
